content.user_title: Create and edit Word, PDF, and PowerPoint documents
content.value_statement: Working with Office documents requires knowledge of multiple tools and formats. This skill provides comprehensive guidance for reading, creating, editing, and converting Word, PDF, and PowerPoint files.
actual_capabilities: Provides guidance for reading Word documents using pandoc and python-docx
Shows how to create new Word documents with the docx-js library
Explains text and table extraction from PDFs with pdfplumber
Demonstrates PDF creation using the reportlab library
Guides PowerPoint editing through OOXML unpacking and repacking
Covers format conversion between DOCX, PDF, PPTX, and Markdown
limitations: Provides guidance only and does not execute document operations directly
Requires external tools like pandoc and LibreOffice to be installed on your system
OCR capabilities require Tesseract installation for scanned document processing
Complex document layouts may require manual adjustments after conversion

best_practices: Use pandoc for format conversions to preserve document structure and styling
Install all system dependencies including LibreOffice and poppler-utils before starting
Validate OOXML documents after manual XML editing to ensure file integrity
anti_patterns: Editing OOXML files without validation can corrupt the document structure
Skipping system tool installation leads to incomplete functionality
Relying on OCR without verification may produce inaccurate text extraction

faq.question: What document formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: DOCX (Word), PDF, and PPTX (PowerPoint) are fully supported with read, create, and edit guidance.

faq.question: What software do I need to install?
faq.answer: Python libraries (pdfplumber, reportlab, pypdf) plus system tools (pandoc, LibreOffice, poppler-utils).

faq.question: Can this skill handle tracked changes in Word documents?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill explains how to view and edit tracked changes using OOXML manipulation techniques.

faq.question: Is my document data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No, this skill only provides guidance. All document processing happens locally on your machine.

faq.question: How do I handle password-protected PDFs?
faq.answer: PDFs with passwords require decryption first. Use pypdf with the password parameter to unlock them.

faq.question: Can I convert scanned documents to editable text?
faq.answer: Yes, use pytesseract for OCR. Convert PDF pages to images first, then run text recognition.
